alert.note: Alert for Haywood; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SWAIN AND NORTHWESTERN HAYWOOD COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Gatlinburg, or 7 miles northeast of Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Cherokee, Waterville, and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
